Title:
Studies on Shiraiaceae introducing a new genus producing
Hypocrellins
Abstract:
Two Hypocrellins producing medicinal fungi ca. Shiraia
bambusicola and a new genus Rabershiraia gen. nov. typified by R.
bambusae are treated in this study. The maximum likelihood phylogenic
analysis, generated from RAxML (GTR+G model) based on combined SSU, LSU,
TEF1 and RPB2 sequences data shows that the new genus Rabershiraia
closes to Shiraia and belongs to family Shiraiaceae. Their descriptions
and illustrations are provided. Morphological differences between the
genera of Shiraiaceae are discussed. A key to Shiraiaceae is provided.
The ascostromatal metabolites Hypocrellin A and Hypocrellin B, are
examined by HPLC. The content of hypocrellin in the new species
Rabershiraia bambusae is twice than that of Shiraia bambusicola.
